Ok, my house is currently in a funny state with the internet. This picture will hopefully explain how the wiring is currently done:
[img:ed4wm9vz]http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/4482/internetgb8.gif[/img:ed4wm9vz]
Now this is the problem, we've just added a new computer in the attic, BUT it can't get internet unless you pull the internet cable coming from downstairs and shove it in the machine, which means the other upstairs computer don't get the internet as you just unplugged it. I'm definite the 'white box' in the attic is down up backwards, and the internet cable should go in the back, split into two so you can have one cable going to the attic computer and one to the second router. I know basically what needs to be done, and vaguely how to do it, but I have never rewired internet cables before (though watch my dad set up this crazy system years ago).

Basically I need advice/instructions on how to reverse the backwards white box in the attic, so both sets of computers are connected. I'd appriciate any help you can offer.

You'll either need a second (long) cable, or you'll need some shorter cables and a hub or router.

Could you look and see which cables (if any) are connected to the WAN port on the router?
